AktaPerlindunganPeribadiDescription1: This page describes a privacy policy that includes the use and protection of information submitted by visitors. If you make a transaction or send an email containing personal information, this information may be shared with other public agencies to assist in the provision of services more effective and efficient. For example as in resolving complaints that require feedback from other agencies.
AktaPerlindunganPeribadiDescription2: No personal information will be collected while you browse this website except for information submitted by you via email.
AktaPerlindunganPeribadiDescription3: Some websites generate 'cookies', which are collected by the web server to allow the website to recognize visitors' future visits. This portal only uses' persistent cookies' or' cookies per session 'which serve as technical purposes such as switching Portal language. These cookies do not permanently record data and are not stored on the hard drive of a visitor's computer. Once you close your browser, cookies are deleted.
AktaPerlindunganPeribadiTitle4: This website has links to other websites
AktaPerlindunganPeribadiDescription4: This privacy policy only applies to this website. Please note that the websites contained in the links may have different privacy policies and visitors are advised to research and understand the privacy policies of each website.
AktaPerlindunganPeribadiDescription5: If this privacy policy is amended, the amendment will be updated on this page. By frequently browsing this page, you will be updated with the information collected, how it is used and in certain circumstances, how the information is shared with others.

BalaiCerapDeskripsi: The Park of the Ancient Observatory is an exhibition located outside the National Planetarium building. In this park there are replicas of the ancient observatories, Stonehenge and Jai Singh Observatory.
BasDeskripsi:
REDLINE Go KL Bus Service and KL Hop-in Hop-off Bus will stop at Station No. 12 National Museum. Visitors need to go through the bridge from the National Museum to the National Planetarium.

The KL Hop-On-Hop-Off Bus Service will also stop at Station No. 20 in front of the KL Bird Park Main Entrance. Visitors need to walk from the Bird Park to the National Planetarium.

FasilitiPlanetariumDescription: The National Planetarium provides various facilities for the comfort of visitors to delve into the field of Astronomy and Space Science. This also includes the convenience of renting some space in the National Planetarium. Please see: National Planetarium Fee Act
FasilitiNota: Note: Half day 4 hours & One day 8 Hours

KembaraSimulasi2Gambar: See outer space before your eyes
KembaraSimulasiDeskripsi: Space Pod is a two-place cockpit simulator seating that provides exploration and flight experience to outer space. Visitors will experience the movement of three axis with 360 degree freedom of movement.
KenderaanPersendirianDeskripsi:
Visitors can use the navigation app to get to the National Planetarium using the GPS address and coordinates below:

GPS Address: National Planetarium

GPS coordinates: 3.1396 ° N, 101.6887 ° E
KenderaanPersendirian1Deskripsi3: From Jalan Bangsar, continue to the KTM Train Station, the left side of the KTM circle towards the National Mosque.
KenderaanPersendirian1Deskripsi4: From Jalan Mahameru, turn left onto Jalan Parlimen. At the traffic light, turn right towards Taman Tasik Kuala Lumpur.
KenderaanPersendirianBangsarDeskripsi: Drive straight to the KTM Station and exit at 1 o'clock in a circle with the position of the National Mosque on the left. Continue driving and turn left when you meet the first junction 3. Continue driving until you reach the National Planetarium.
KenderaanPersendirianParlimenDeskripsi: Drive straight to Jalan Cenderawasih. Turn left onto Jalan Tanglin and continue driving to Jalan Lembah. On the left there is the Police Headquarters in Raja Bukit Aman and Taman Burung. Turn right onto Jalan Perdana. arrived at the National Planetarium.
KeretaApiDeskripsi:
The KTM Komuter Railway service will stop at the Kuala Lumpur Old KTM Railway Station which is located near the National Mosque. Visitors need to walk from Masjid Negara to the National Planetarium.

Kelana Jaya Line Rapid Service (Putra LRT) will stop at KL Sentral Station. Visitors need to take a bus or walk along the sidewalk to the National Planetarium.

The MRT service will stop at the National Museum Station. Visitors need to go through the bridge from the National Museum to the National Planetarium.
KeretapiDeskripsi: Use the train transport service and stop at the National Museum MRT Station (SBK15). Walk using the footbridge to the National Planetarium.
KutubkhanahMiniArkibDeskripsi: Contains reference materials related to the National Planetarium available in various forms of printed and non-printed materials. Among them are audio, news, brochures, flyers, media statements, information packing, publications, speeches, videos.
KutubkhanahMiniBukuDeskripsi: Covers domestic and foreign published monographs. Monograph means a book that covers all areas of matter such as General Works, Philosophy, Religion, Social Sciences, Language, Teak Science, Technology, Applied Science, Arts, Literature, Geography and History.
KutubkhanahMinieSumberDeskripsi: Contains a collection of audio visual and electronic resources that are non-printed materials in various areas of matter and format such as audio cassettes, video cassettes, data compact discs (CD-ROM), audio discs, video discs, digital video discs and kits published in and abroad in the custody of PN.
KutubkhanahMiniMengenaiKamiDeskripsi1: Kutubkhanah Mini Planetarium Negara was opened to the public on 2 June 2018, corresponding to 17 Ramadhan 1439H. This collection of books at Kutubkhanah Mini consists mostly of astronomy and space science subjects as well as other general subjects such as general works, philosophy, social sciences and so on. The books have been compiled and cataloged to make it easier for people to search and reference.
KutubkhanahMiniMengenaiKamiDeskripsi2: Kutubkhanah Mini at the National Planetarium also supports the KLBACA! program which began on April 23, 2020, where the capital Kuala Lumpur was chosen as the 20th city for this celebration.
KutubkhanahMiniMengenaiKamiDeskripsi3: Kutubkhanah Mini strives to increase the collection of digital material resources to be accessible to all walks of life.
KutubkhanahMiniPerkhidmatan1: Loan services to members of Kutubkhanah Mini
KutubkhanahMiniPerkhidmatan4: Online search of magazines and newspapers
KutubkhanahMiniTerbitanBersiriDeskripsi: The source of information in the series of publications consists of printed, non-printed, electronic and online materials. Among the collections of materials available are magazines, newspapers, annual reports, yearbooks, guidebooks, journals, indices, abstracts, statistics, government gazettes and acts.
LainlainAktivitiExample: example: Using a telescope to observe the sun
LawatanPlanetariumDescription: As the astronomy education center of the country visitors can study and understand astronomy through a medium of delivery interactive and interesting. The National Planetarium provides info and information through exhibition materials, space shows, space pod and facilities that are capable of making a visit to The National Planetarium is something meaningful to visitors.
LawatanPlanetariumTempah: Book your visit to the National Planetarium today
Mengenaikamideskripsi: The National Planetarium is an informal educational institution in the field of Astronomy and Space Science. Located on 14 acres of land in the area of ​​Perdana Botanical Garden, Kuala Lumpur. Its unique architecture is characterized by Islamic architecture inspired by the achievements of Astonomy and Space Science during the heyday of Islamic civilization.
MOSTI: Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation (MOSTI)

PenafianDescription: The Government of Malaysia and the National Planetarium, Kuala Lumpur shall not be liable for any loss or damage caused by the usage of any information obtained from this website.
PenerbitanPlanetariumDescription:
In the effort of the National Planetarium to promote and improve public awareness of the importance of Astronomy and Space Science in the aspect of national development, various publications have been produced by the National Planetarium.

Publications The National Planetarium includes conventional publications and electronics with quality design and content for meet the needs of the reader as well as ensure that the titles which is published to the benefit of its readers. This effort is seen as capable further strengthen the reader's knowledge of the science of Astronomy and Space Science that they already have.
PengangkutanAwamDeskripsi1: KL Sentral Bus Service, get off at the National Museum. Use the bridge provided.
PengangkutanAwamDeskripsi2: KL Hop-On-Hop-Off Double Decker Tour Bus Service, get off at Station No. 20 in front of the KL Bird Park Main Entrance. Buses are available every 30 to 45 minutes.
PengangkutanAwamDeskripsi3: KTM Commuter Train Service, get off at the Kuala Lumpur KTM Old Railway Station located near the National Mosque.
PengangkutanAwamDeskripsi4: Public taxis - It is recommended to find a taxi using a coupon or metered system.
PetaLakaranPlanetariumDescription: Exhibitions themed on astronomy and space exploration are provided so that visitors can experience a unique learning experience through hands-on and minds-on concepts.
PetaLakaranPlanetariumNote: Note: Please click on the exhibition gallery sketch link below to see more.

PrivacyPolicy1Description: This page describes the privacy policy that covers the use and protection of information submitted by visitors. If you wish to register and make a transaction or send an email containing personal information, this information may be shared with other public agencies to assist in the provision of more effective and efficient services. For example, in resolving complaints that require feedback from other agencies.
PrivacyPolicy2Description: The latest technologies including data encryption are used to protect the data submitted and adherence to strict security standards is applied to prevent unauthorized access.
PrivacyPolicy3Description: All electronic storage and transmission of personal data will be protected and stored using appropriate security technology.
PrivacyPolicy4Description: No personal information will be collected while you browse the official website of the National Planetarium except for information submitted by you via email which is a protected part of this website.
PrivacyPolicy5Description: We warmly welcome your feedback / inquiries. If the required detailed information is not available on this website, your requirements will be forwarded to the relevant agency.
PrivacyPolicy6Title: What happens if I make a link to another website?
PrivacyPolicy6Description: This website has links to the websites of Government agencies and non-Government agencies. This privacy policy only applies to this website. It should be noted that the websites contained in these website links may have different privacy policies and visitors are advised to research and understand the privacy policies of each website visited.
PrivacyPolicy7Description: If this privacy policy is amended, the amendments will be updated on this page. By frequently browsing this page, you will be updated with the information collected, how it is used and in certain circumstances, how the information is shared with others.
PrivacyPolicy8Description: If you have any questions or complaints about this privacy policy or website, you can contact us through the Contact Us section provided in this website.
ProgramPendidikanDescription: Education Module was developed to promote the teaching and learning of astronomy by hands-on in attracting interest and raising awareness of the importance of space science and astronomy to the general public especially teachers and school students. Various interactive modules were developed in supporting the standard curriculum of primary and secondary schools through an “informal” approach. aspects of science communication, creativity and high-level thinking skills.Development of educational modules in the form of Minds-On, Hearts-On, Hands-On Learning Engagement strengthen and develop space science and astronomy education and add value ( add value ) to the existing education syllabus.
ProgramPendidikanSuccessMessage: We will respond to the application within 3 working days

Role1: Establish and lead the Ministry's Information and Communications Technology (ICT) security work team;
Role2: Assist the Secretary General in performing tasks involving ICT security;
Role4: Coordinate the development and implementation of training plans and awareness programs on ICT security;
Role5: Ensure all users understand and comply with the Ministry's Security Policy ICT (DKICT);
Role6: Ensure that all organizational needs (financial resources, consumer resources and security protections) are adequate; and
Role7: Ensure risk assessment and ICT security programs in the Ministry's DKICT in accordance with the circular in force.

ServiceFacility3Description: Surau is provided for the use of visitors.
ShowStep1Note: Note: Online tickets must be booked at least one day in advance.
SpacePodDescription: Space Pod is a two-seater cockpit simulator that provides passengers with space exploration and aviation experience. upright conditions at all times. Safety measures are as follows:
SpacePodStepSafety1: Minimum passenger height limit is 1.2 meters.
SpacePodStepSafety2: The maximum weight of both passengers at a given time is 226 kilograms.
SpacePodStepSafety3: Passengers suffering from the following dangerous diseases are not allowed:
SpacePodStepSafety3d: Symptoms of drug allergies or under the influence of alcohol
SpacePodStepSafety3f: Symptoms of Nyctophobia (dark phobia) and Claustrophobia (narrow phobia)
SpacePodStepSafety4: Pregnant women and seniors over the age of 70 are not encouraged to embark on this Space Pod.
SpacePodStepSafety5: Passengers must ensure that all non-binding items such as pens, coins, mobile phones and other items that can be removed during this simulation trip are in operation.
SpacePodStepSafety6: Passengers need to be in an upright position and not panic if this Simulation Journey is abruptly stopped by the operator during an emergency.
SpacePodStep1Agreement: I agree with the above statement.
SpacePodStep2Note: Note: Online tickets need to be booked a day in advance to facilitate Planetarium business.
SpacePodStep3Note: Note: Sorry. Space pod is only possible ridden by 2 people in 1 time.
SpacePodStep4Note: Note: Please be 10 minutes in advance before the simulation journey begins and avoid booking overlapping with planetarium screening time (if any). Thank you.

TamanRekreasiDeskripsi: The National Planetarium Recreation Park is decorated with Astronomical trails such as Mercury Trail, Saturn Trail, Neptune Trail and so on. Visitors also have the opportunity to see the decorated rocks constellation painting and space sculpture - time as garden decoration art. In addition, it is also decorated with the Merdeka Sun Clock was built in 1957 and was originally located in the area Merdeka Stadium. Transfer of Merdeka Sun Clock to Planetarium The country is in collaboration with the Space Science Division (BAKSA) and United Engineering Malaysia (UEM) with the approval of the City Hall Kuala Lumpur (DBKL).
TambahKeTroliBerjaya: Your order has successfully entered the cart. Thank you.
TayanganPlanetariumDeskripsi: The Space Theater resembles a movie theater that becomes the benchmark of a Planetarium. It can be seen in terms of size scale capable of accommodating up to 200 spectators in a time and technology infrastructure to help simulate movement and uniqueness of different objects in the galaxy. Ia has a hemisphere aluminum dome equipped with a sound system 6-channel digital circuit. Two full dome immersive projectors the system provides astronomical impressions and simulations of the night sky resembles an observatory.
